channel.title: Helix on RD's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Helix on RD's Blog

item.title: Protein Kinases: Evolution of Dynamic Regulatory Proteins
item.description: Notes on 2010 Cell Review article exploring the structural and evolutionary principles that shape the dynamic regulatory mechanisms of protein kinases.

item.title: Protein Kinases: Evolution of Dynamic Regulatory Proteins
item.description: Notes on 2010 Cell Review article exploring the structural and evolutionary principles that shape the dynamic regulatory mechanisms of protein kinases.

item.title: F-Helix as a Structural Scaffold for Active Protein Kinase Assembly
item.description: Notes on 2008_PNAS paper revealing F-helix as a hub for regulatory and catalytic spine anchoring in protein kinases.

item.title: F-Helix as a Structural Scaffold for Active Protein Kinase Assembly
item.description: Notes on 2008_PNAS paper revealing F-helix as a hub for regulatory and catalytic spine anchoring in protein kinases.

item.title: SOCKET: A Program for Identifying and Analyzing Coiled-Coil Motifs within Protein Structures
item.description: Notes on the 2001 JMB paper introducing SOCKET, a computational tool that identifies coiled-coil motifs based on structural features rather than sequence patterns. Highlights the diversity of coiled-coil structures, the central role of knobs-into-holes packing, and applications in structural analysis and design.

item.title: SOCKET: A Program for Identifying and Analyzing Coiled-Coil Motifs within Protein Structures
item.description: Notes on the 2001 JMB paper introducing SOCKET, a computational tool that identifies coiled-coil motifs based on structural features rather than sequence patterns. Highlights the diversity of coiled-coil structures, the central role of knobs-into-holes packing, and applications in structural analysis and design.

item.title: Principles of Helix-Helix Packing in Proteins: The Helical Lattice Superposition Model
item.description: Notes on the 1996 JMB paper introducing the Helical Lattice Superposition Model for analyzing helix-helix packing geometry in proteins. Explores mathematical formulations of optimal packing angles, comparing ‘knobs into holes’ and ‘ridges into grooves’ models, and provides insights into amino acid preferences and packing flexibility.

item.title: Principles of Helix-Helix Packing in Proteins: The Helical Lattice Superposition Model
item.description: Notes on the 1996 JMB paper introducing the Helical Lattice Superposition Model for analyzing helix-helix packing geometry in proteins. Explores mathematical formulations of optimal packing angles, comparing ‘knobs into holes’ and ‘ridges into grooves’ models, and provides insights into amino acid preferences and packing flexibility.

item.title: Mechanism of CDK Activation Revealed by the Structure of a CyclinA-CDK2 Complex
item.description: Notes on a 1995 Nature paper revealing the structural mechanism of CDK2 activation by cyclinA, focusing on key conformational changes that relieve autoinhibition and organize the catalytic site.

item.title: Mechanism of CDK Activation Revealed by the Structure of a CyclinA-CDK2 Complex
item.description: Notes on a 1995 Nature paper revealing the structural mechanism of CDK2 activation by cyclinA, focusing on key conformational changes that relieve autoinhibition and organize the catalytic site.

item.title: Unexpected Structure of the Ca2+-Regulatory Region from Soybean Calcium-dependent Protein Kinase-Alpha
item.description: Notes on a 2004 JBC paper uncovering the high-resolution structure of the Ca2+-regulatory domain of soybean CDPK-alpha, revealing novel lobe interactions and a pivot-based mechanism, distinct from calmodulin-based models.

item.title: Unexpected Structure of the Ca2+-Regulatory Region from Soybean Calcium-dependent Protein Kinase-Alpha
item.description: Notes on a 2004 JBC paper uncovering the high-resolution structure of the Ca2+-regulatory domain of soybean CDPK-alpha, revealing novel lobe interactions and a pivot-based mechanism, distinct from calmodulin-based models.

item.title: Predicting Coiled-Coil from Protein Sequences: A 1991 Science Classic
item.description: Notes on the foundational 1991 Science paper introducing a sequence-based method to predict coiled-coil domains. This paper outlines a statistical framework using heptad repeat patterns, Gaussian distributions, and sliding windows, uncovering over 200 proteins in GenBank with potential coiled-coil motifs.

item.title: Predicting Coiled-Coil from Protein Sequences: A 1991 Science Classic
item.description: Notes on the foundational 1991 Science paper introducing a sequence-based method to predict coiled-coil domains. This paper outlines a statistical framework using heptad repeat patterns, Gaussian distributions, and sliding windows, uncovering over 200 proteins in GenBank with potential coiled-coil motifs.
